etymology.description: 子(子) (zǐ, "child") below 老(老) (lǎo, "old") = child carrying the elder -> filial piety
etymology.interpretation: 孝 represents the concept of filial piety by depicting a child 子(子) supporting an elder 老(老), symbolizing the responsibility and respect a child has towards their parents and elders.

examples.chinese: 他对父母非常孝(他對父母非常孝)。
examples.english: He is very filial to his parents.

examples.chinese: 我们学习孝顺的传统(我們學習孝順的傳統)，以报答父母的恩情(以報答父母的恩情)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen xuéxí xiàoshùn de chuántǒng, yǐ bàodá fùmǔ de ēnqíng.
examples.english: We study the tradition of filial piety to repay our parents' kindness.
